page.title: 07DAIRY FARMING IN RATHFRILAND
page.content: DAIRY FARMING IS THE MOST COMMON TYPE OF FARMING IN THE RATHFRILAND AREA. THE NUMBER OF COWS ON A DAIRY FARM CAN VARY FROM 30 TO 150.DAIRY FARMING IS A VERY DEMANDING JOB AS THE COWS HAVE TO BE MILKED TWICE EACH DAY. AT 7a.m. THE COWS ARE BROUGHT INTO THE MILKING PARLOUR AND MILKED. IT USUALLY TAKES 2 HOURS TO MILK THE COWS. WHEN THEY ARE MILKED THEY ARE RETURNED TO THE FIELD. AGAIN AT 5p.m. THE COWS ARE BROUGHT BACK INTO THE PARLOUR AND MILKED AGAIN. DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS THE COWS ARE FED ON GRASS. IN THE WINTER THE COWS ARE FED ON SILAGE.
